meanings.definition: A sharp slap or blow, typically with the palm of the hand.
meanings.sent1: He felt the sharp smack on his cheek.
meanings.sent2: The smack on the table echoed in the room.
meanings.sent3: The clown's exaggerated smack on his own face made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The news of the scandal hit him like a smack to the face.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the smack was so loud, it startled everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: A taste or flavor that is distinctive and strong.
meanings.sent1: The cake had a sweet smack of vanilla.
meanings.sent2: The spicy smack of the chili lingered on his tongue.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected smack of garlic in the dessert puzzled the guests.
meanings.sent4: The wine had a rich smack of oak and berries.
meanings.sent5: The soup's smack of saltiness made it irresistible.

meanings.definition: To strike with a sharp blow.
meanings.sent1: He smacks the ball with all his strength.
meanings.sent2: She smacks the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The cat smacks the toy mouse around playfully.
meanings.sent4: The storm smacks the trees with fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The boxer smacks his opponent with a powerful punch.

meanings.definition: To have a flavor that is distinctive and strong.
meanings.sent1: The soup smacks of garlic and herbs.
meanings.sent2: The dish smacks of exotic spices.
meanings.sent3: The cake unexpectedly smacks of lemon zest.
meanings.sent4: The coffee smacks of roasted beans and chocolate.
meanings.sent5: The sauce smacks of tangy tomatoes and basil.
